bel.processing package¶

Submodules¶

bel.processing.decomposition module¶

This script pre-processes the data. - It subdivides the breakthrough curves into an arbitrary number of steps, as the mt3dms results do not necessarily share the same time steps - d - It computes the signed distance field for each particles endpoints file - h It then perform PCA keeping all components on both d and h. Finally, CCA is performed after selecting an appropriate number of PC to keep.

It saves 2 pca objects (d, h) and 1 cca object, according to the project ecosystem.

bel.processing.decomposition.bel(n_training=300, n_test=5, new_dir=None)¶

This function loads raw data and perform both PCA and CCA on it. It saves results as pkl objects that have to be loaded in the forecast_error.py script to perform predictions.

Parameters

  • n_training – Number of samples used to train the model

  • n_test – Number of samples on which to perform prediction

  • new_dir – Name of the forecast directory

Returns

bel.processing.signed_distance module¶

class bel.processing.signed_distance.SignedDistance(x_lim=None, y_lim=None, grf=1)¶

Bases: object

function(pzs)¶

Given an array of coordinates of polygon vertices, computes its signed distance field. :param pzs: Array of ordered vertices coordinates of a polygon. :return: Signed distance matrix

matrix_poly_bin(pzs, outside=-1, inside=1)¶

Given a polygon whose vertices are given by the array pzs, and a matrix of centroids coordinates of the surface discretization, assign to the matrix a certain value whether the cell is inside or outside said polygon. To compute the signed distance function, we need a negative/positive value.

Parameters

  • pzs – Polygon vertices

  • outside – Value to assign to the matrix outside of the polygon

  • inside – Value to assign to the matrix inside of the polygon

Returns

phi, the binary matrix

bel.processing.signed_distance.get_centroids(array, grf)¶

Given a m x n matrix, returns the m x n x 2 matrix of the coordinates of centroids.
